alert.note: Alert for Adams; Juneau; Monroe; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 26 at 3:23PM CST until February 27 at 12:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Freezing Rain, Snow Overnight Through Monday... .A potent, quick moving storm system will bring freezing rain and snow to the region overnight through the day Monday. Freezing rain spreads into and north of Interstate 94 overnight, starting to mix with and then change over to snow by mid to late Monday morning. Snow persists, mostly north of Highway 10 in north-central Wisconsin, through the afternoon with the storm exiting northeast in the evening. Icing up to one third inch is possible. With winds expected to gust 30 to 40, areas that receive the heavier icing could experience tree damage and power outages. The bulk of the snow accumulations will be confined north of Highway 29 in north- central Wisconsin with a few inches possible. Temperatures will play a key role in what falls where, and how much. Small changes could result in shifts in precipitation types and amounts. Pay close attention to later forecasts for any revisions to what is expected. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO NOON CST MONDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of up to two tenths of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Trempealeau, Monroe, Juneau and Adams Counties. * WHEN...From 3 AM to noon CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
